p:
Counts of Sporormiella spp. spores were performed in 76 of the pollen preparations
32 from a stratigraphic section in grid 14AD that includes units PB-7, PB-8, and PB-9. A magnification of 400× was used, and added Lycopodium spores were used to calculate concentrations. The determination of Sporormiella spp., characterised by its sigmoidal germinal opening and dark brown color, was performed using keys, photographs, and morphological descriptions (cf. refs
135– 138 ). Spores were analyzed by N.C-M. at the Universidad Austral de Chile in Valdivia.
